title: About Me
content: Hi, I'm Porter. I am a recent graduate of Earlham College. I like to code, innovate, and solve.

Front-end web developer, skilled at validating, debugging, and correcting code with experience working on development teams; motivated to create customer-focused, high-quality and effective website layouts. Currently looking to join an organization with an emphasis on teamwork and collaboration.

title: Dex
content: A practice project which invloved two different specific technologies I wanted to work with. The first is webscraping and compiling data, the second is using a python library like Flask to create a website and a server. Pokemon provided a nice, medium-sized dataset to practice with; not to big to be quick to process, but large enough to create a cool result.

title: EPIC Journey
content: A site requested by the EPIC program at Earlham College to help prospective students explore the options available to them.

title: Orbit
content: A simple space physics simlation I wrote in python using the pygame library. This was mostly a practice project, both with rendering things based on physics forumlas, and working with pygame.

title: Color Shift
content: Color Shift is an android mobile game built in Unity. This was a solo project to practice my UX design as well as C# programming. After some of my previous projects, I wanted to work on something where I could really perfect a UI control system, so that it would be compadible with most Android devices.

title: SpellBound
content: Spellbound is a co-op platformer game, originally created for CS380. The game is built using the Unity engine with C# as the primary scripting language. All the art and music are original, and created by our team. This game has evolved beyond a school project, and has given us experience working as a remote team, and developing in cycles. While the game will likely remain unpublished, we all care deeply about it as a personal project, and have learned many lessons from our work.

title: Euclidean Step Sequencer
content: This project was created for Project 1 in CS345 : Software Engineering. The sequencer is designed to express 1 to 6 voices, each with many configurable options, including key, octave, wave type, and more. Each voice has a configurable number of pulses, which will be distributed evenly across the selected number of steps, resulting in complex polyrhythms and interesting offbeat patterns.

title: YaHeard
content: YaHeard is a geotagging, semi-anonymous social network, created in React Native for both Android and iOS. It is meant to be a content driven network, where the context of the post itself is removed from any personal information which might destract from the quality of the content.

title: Datavis 2
content: The datavis tool is used to visualize collected data from a Postgres Database used for the Icelandic Field Studies program at Earlham College. Built to replace an earlier implimentation using Python and Flask, and optimize use with mobile devices.

title: EC Soundcloud
content: This widget was created for the new Earlham College website, which is built in Apostrophe CMS, and uses the soundcloud API to fetch and render data in a professional, podcast-style display, complete with navigations and a web player.
